label: TIE Reputation Change Event Example
info:
This sample registers with the DXL fabric to receive reputation change events
sent by TIE when the reputation of a file or certificate changes. The payload
from the event message received is printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
  [DXL Configuration Sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).
* A TIE service is available on the DXL fabric.

### Setup

To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
 screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
with the word `connected` should appear under the
`Receive TIE file reputation change event` and
`Receive TIE cert reputation change event` nodes.

### Running

The next step is to force a reputation change for a file or certificate via ePO.
The steps to accomplish this are listed below:

* Open ePO and navigate to the `"TIE Reputations"` page.
* Select the `"File Search"` or `"Certificate Search"` tab
* Select a `file` or `certificate` in the list
* Click the `"Actions"` button at the bottom left and select a new "Enterprise"
  reputation (for example, `Known Trusted`)

  **Note**: It is safest to select a file (or certificate) that has a "GTI"
  Reputation of `Known Trusted` and simply set the "Enterprise" reputation to be
  the same (`Known Trusted`).

* Remove the override by clicking on the `"Actions"` button again and selecting
  `"Remove Override"`

### Output

After the reputation change has occurred, a entry similar to following should
appear in the Node-RED `debug` tab:

```
▶ { newReputations: object, relationships: object, hashes: object,
updateTime: 1526675921, oldReputations: object }
```

Click on the right arrow buttons to expand the contents of the object. The
content should look similar to the following:

```
▼ object
 ▼ newReputations: object
  ▼ 1: object
   ▼ attributes: object
       2120340: "2139160704"
     createDate: 1451502875
     providerId: 1
     trustLevel: 99
  ▼ 3: object
   ▼ attributes: object
       2101652: "17"
       2102165: "1451502875"
       2111893: "21"
       2114965: "0"
       2139285: "72339069014638857"
     createDate: 1526675921
     providerId: 3
     trustLevel: 99
 ▼ hashes: object
     md5: "f2c7bb8acc97f92e987a2d4087d021b1"
     sha1: "7eb0139d2175739b3ccb0d1110067820be6abd29"
     sha256: "142e1d688ef0568370c37187fd9f2351d7ddeda574f8bfa9b0fa4ef42db85aa2"
   updateTime: 1526675921
 ▼ oldReputations: object
  ▼ 1: object
   ▼ attributes: object
       2120340: "2139160704"
     createDate: 1451502875
     providerId: 1
     trustLevel: 99
  ▼ 3: object
   ▼ attributes: object
       2101652: "17"
       2102165: "1451502875"
       2111893: "21"
       2114965: "0"
       2139285: "72339069014638857"
     createDate: 1451502875
     providerId: 3
     trustLevel: 99
```

The `reputation change` information is separated into 4 distinct sections:

#### Hash values

An object of hashes that identify the file or certificate whose reputation has
changed.

#### New reputations

The new `Reputations` for the file or certificate whose reputation has changed
(as an object).

#### Old reputations

The previous `Reputations` for the file or certificate whose reputation has
changed (as an object).

#### Change time

The time the reputation change occurred.

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Receive TIE file reputation change event

This is a `tie file reputation change event` input node which starts the flow.
This node injects a new message with a `payload` property which includes the
information from the file reputation change event.

#### Receive TIE cert reputation change event

This is a `tie cert reputation change event` input node which starts the flow.
This node injects a new message with a `payload` property which includes the
information from the certificate reputation change event.

#### Output result

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on
the message by the either the `Receive TIE file reputation change event` or
`Receive TIE cert reputation change event` node.

name: Receive TIE file reputation change event
Receive TIE cert reputation change event
